action.action-desc: Mr. Fitzpatrick (for himself, Mr. Gottheimer, Mr. Carson of Indiana, Mr. King of New York, Mr. Jones, Mr. Lance, Mr. MacArthur, Mr. Blum, Mr. Thomas J. Rooney of Florida, Mr. Nadler, Ms. Bordallo, Mr. Huffman, Mr. Thompson of Pennsylvania, Mr. Capuano, Mr. Keating, Mr. Swalwell of California, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Mr. Perlmutter, Ms. Tsongas, and Mr. Marino) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To direct the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration to issue an order with respect to secondary cockpit barriers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Saracini Aviation Safety Act of 2017.

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall issue an order that requires—

paragraph.text: on each covered aircraft the installation of a barrier, other than the cockpit door, that prevents access to the flight deck of the aircraft; and

subparagraph.text: that is equipped with a cockpit door, that the barrier required under paragraph (1) remain locked while—

clause.text: the aircraft is in flight; and
the cockpit door separating the flight deck and the passenger area is open; and

subparagraph.text: that is not equipped with a cockpit door, that the barrier required under paragraph (1) remain locked as determined appropriate by the pilot in command.

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered aircraft means a commercial aircraft—

paragraph.text: operating under part 121 of title 14, Code of Federal Regulations;
equipped with more than 75 passenger seats; and
with a maximum gross takeoff weight that exceeds 75,000 pounds.
